title: Ticket #1818: condor_q -format crashes when formatting QDate re the manual
description:
on windows, the command 
condor_q -format "%s" "formatTime(QDate,""%0m/%d %H:%M"")"
causes condor_q to crash. (unless the queue is empty).
remarks:
2010-Dec-21 12:18:07 by tannenba:
Bug is reproducible at UW for both v7.2.4 (as reported by the user) and in v7.5.5.

2010-Dec-27 13:28:52 by tannenba:
The problem is "%0m" is not an ANSI allowable format specifier, and the Windows C runtime throws an exception. "%m" is fine, but "%0m" is not. The Condor Manual says the right thing - the manual explicitly states that only ANSI standard format specifiers are allowed by formatTime, and it lists the allowed specifiers.

I edited HowToWriteaCondorqWrapper so the example works correctly on Windows as well as Unix, and resolved the associated RUST. Resolving this ticket.
creator: johnkn
